storyInfo: Listening to a storyteller's tale, Lava and her cohorts find themselves in a strange town. All manner of strange happenings lead them to understand they may be in a difficult situation.

attributes.text: Let us continue where we left off. We tell of the lame scholar
From whence does his story come?
Naturally, a painting.
What painting?
The scholar
To paint what?
To paint that never before seen.
How would he paint it?
He would think thoughts never before thought.
Ah, now that we
After all, under our heavens, where can you find one capable of thinking something as yet unseen?
The scholar faced the blank paper and strained his mind for about ten days, losing more than thirty jin of weight. He had already been lame, and his appearance grew ever more fearful.
Come the deep winter, the scholar
Until one day, the lame scholar again woke in a haze, his limbs powerless, yet his mind clear.
He knew well his limits were soon coming. He looked around him, his home a bare four walls and a dim room, and felt only that all around him was void, that he truly had become alone in the world.

The scholar gradually became unable to see the floor before him wet and frozen by the snowstorm, unable to hear the biting wind coming through his door and window. He opened his eyes and blinked, fallen into primal chaos, and felt that the walls were wandering far away, his desk dissipating, his brush, paper, ink and stone all ephemeral as smoke.

At a certain moment, he suddenly came to know the exact number of snowflakes in the flurry outside his window, came to know the angle of the moonlight and the truth of the clouds. He reached out fumbling for the curtain of night, and crashed to the floor in carelessness, but the floor was no longer a hindrance to his legs. He fell underground, and then flew into the empty depths.

He could not see with his open eyes, could not hear with his rapt attention, the darkness surrounding him whole—he suddenly went into an ecstasy, as if only in this boundary where naught existed to disturb him, he could seek his true work, rather than copy or desecrate that which already existed.

He continued to wait, wait until all had faded to null, until he could not feel even his own withered flesh, before he began to think—only when all creation and all beings had ceased to exist, and his consciousness was alone in clarity, had he briefly become master of his soul.
His imagination would never again be restricted, creating works of that which simultaneously existed and did not exist—on his territory of thought, all strangeness arose equal, and enveloped reality.
It was deep in the night, and as a teacher awoke next door, he saw the lame scholar
With just that one glimpse, he dared not investigate further. He hurried himself back indoors, and for a very long time could not fall asleep.
The next day, neighbors thronged before the thatched cottage. They forced the door and entered, discovering the scholar

Afterwards, the people lamented that the scholar could not leave his past, dying obsessed in front of his scroll. Others said the scholar had long since contracted some strange disease, could not control his own Arts, and only thus did this strange case unfold.

The teacher, who alone had glimpsed the truth, never talked of the matter with anyone else. It was only in his final moments he told his son; that the disdained lame scholar, even his name forgotten, was a true master of all eternity.

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Villager

attributes.content: Because that night, the lame scholar had in reality fulfilled his promise. He had, in reality, painted 'that which had never before been in this world.'
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Why do I feel like the books told it pretty differently?
attributes.name: Villager

attributes.content: The teacher had not the time to explain, or perhaps he simply swallowed the words he did not have.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Thus in the narrative heard on the streets, there is only the lame scholar's sails billowing with success, up to the fall of his senses.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: As for the truth of things, I fear not a single soul now knows.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: See, though, what's so hard about drawing something you've never seen before? I could head back, smear up a scroll, and none of you would've ever seen that.
attributes.name: Villager

attributes.content: Ah, you can't put it like that. You've never seen a vast lake before, but you've seen the ponded waters after the rains. Let me tell you, lakes are ponded waters made vast. In the end, you've seen them before.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: If the lame scholar had strength, then this is where it lay.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Well if all that's true, then what in the world did he paint?
attributes.name: Villager

attributes.content: Who knows.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Look, could you give the contrived stories a rest? They're not exactly the most fun. Are you gonna tell any others?
attributes.name: Villager

attributes.content: I want to hear the ending to the one with 'a lone soul ventures forth to Heaven, twin blade lovers that split the lands!'
attributes.name: Child

attributes.content: I'll tell in due time, all of it. It is not possible to tell all under heaven in totality, and I use my scarce predestined hundred or so years of life to tell what I might. If I yet pursued thoroughness on top of it, that would be quite greedy.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: As you'd like to hear it, then next time, we'll tell of something else.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Alright!
attributes.name: Child

attributes.content: By custom, my mouth is worth no money. But when you've paid your tea, see what you might have for an old man's story.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: It seems we've got a few new faces today. Three mysterious visitors; I hope these strange tales of mine were to your satisfaction?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Was that fiction?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: If someone told me a scholar caught Oripathy, and met his end in melancholy before his wishes were complete, then I'd certainly believe it was true.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Add some spice and flourish, and the story tastes all the better.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Quite sensible!
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: My thanks.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: However, I'm not sure myself how many really are true, out of all these anecdotal legends... I just have some interest in the field, nothing more.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: That said, while I might not be any kind of formal storyteller, I've spent a long time in the village doing it, though only the few you saw are actually willing to hear me spout my nonsense.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: I see three unfamiliar faces. What brings you here?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Ahem— (Gives a meaningful look)
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Ah—right, right, these two friends of mine came from far away, in search of someone.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: But neither of them are quite as aware of Yan as those of us born here, so I'm giving them some small assistance, acting as their guide. How should I address you, sir?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: It's been many years since I left home; I long since abandoned my old name to disuse. I fancied myself literary in younger years, calling myself the 'Umbrella-Boiling Hermit,' and though it's somewhat shameless of a title, I still use it to this day.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: How artistic! How artistic indeed! By damned luck, I too was given no option but to leave home, and nowadays go by 'No' and 'thing' in lieu of names sur and given. You can call me Brother No, how about that?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: (I told you that was a made-up name, didn't I—?!)
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: (Kroos? You catch something?)
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: (Eh? Uh, nothing, I just reckon it's really fun to watch how he lies himself a new layer every time.)
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: So we are both men fallen to the other side of the world. Then who's the person you three mysteries are searching for?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Hah, just as the proverb goes, chance meetings are predestiny; it truly couldn't be more opportune if we tried. The one we're searching for is also a painter, like in the story we just heard.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: ...A painter? This village is modestly sized, and I've never heard of any painter here. What manner of man is this?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Er... benefactor? May you describe?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: A woman. Uh, she should have big, weird horns on her head. And she can use some weird Arts. Also... also... she's a painter.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: And that's it?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: That's it.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: I admit, with that, I have even less of an idea.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Oh, this is a strange turn indeed... could it be that the one you benefactors seek left this place before we came?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: This village entertains very few guests. If it's as you all say, that strange person would have to have left an impression on us. I can get someone to help you ask around.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Good, good, then we'll leave you to it, sir, and for the time being—
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: We'll...?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Mr. Nothing?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Hey, what's up with you?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Ah, heheh, where... where did we come in from?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: What are you talking about? Didn't we—
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: —Follow this pathway, and you can leave the landscape garden.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Presumably you arrived following a crowd, and erred here? Haha, my garden isn't that big or small, but it's tough to find your way through it. Ask a servant for help.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Heh... Look at me, all befuddled. How is it I can't remember, now?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: If you find any trace of that painter, and you need the help, don't hesitate to ask me.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: I have some business for now, so, everyone, farewell.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Here, thank you, thank you, farewell now, farewell. Benefactors, shall we go?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Wait—
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: And that said, where should we take a look at? We've visited the teahouse, the stage station and the gardens. Where else could there be any clues?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: How long has it been since we got here?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Oh, why do you ask? I'd say about... two or three days?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Are you sure?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Ahahah, heh, most likely I slept awful last night. I'm a little out of kilter.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Lavaaa.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Nnng... I can sense it now... but it's so indistinct... it's like...
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Times like these, you've gotta go with your intuition.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: My intuition's telling me that right now, the situation's extremely messed up.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Is it some kind of mind-level Originium Arts...?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Nngh... if it's Arts...
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Benefactors, why the muttering? If we don't hurry up soon, it'll get dark on us.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: What are you talking about? It's still so light—
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: —The sky... the color?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Did we never look at the sky before...? We should've noticed any moment we lifted our heads... now that's odd.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: B... benefactors, what's going on? Look over there, is that... is that a moon, now?!
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: And it's broad daylight right now, isn't it? Why have they lit lanterns on the other end of the bridge?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Look behind you...
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Er?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: The horizon on the other side. Is that... is that the sun?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Hey. You think us coming back from there to here counted as 'going' one full day and night?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: This is really... new to me. Nian always told me that Yan was full of weird, unseen wonders... and landscapes like this too?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Uh, hold on, I think there's something in my pocket...
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Is this—the charm Nian gave me...?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Wait a minute... hold on! No, that's not right!
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: What the hell do I mean 'landscapes like this?' What was I just thinking?!
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Ah...
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Mr. Nothing!
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Er—? I'm here, I'm here!
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Is this Ni-weng Village or not!?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Does... does it need to be said... er...
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: P—paying close attention, it seems a little off! But there isn't another village anywhere around!
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: This isn't right. It's not right.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Kroos, we left Rhodes Island, reached Kou-wu City first, stocked up, and then left the next morning.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: We were heading across the wastes for Mount Hui-ch'i, and we saw a crashed car—
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: —and then you two benefactors dealt with the beasts and saved me?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Just took 'em to a nice new pit to build their nest in, that's all.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: And then?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: And then, we...?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Hmmmgh. Then we went straight up Mount Hui-ch'i, and found a thatched cottage.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: I pushed open its...
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: ...door?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Bells? Where are they coming from?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: The bells are sounding? The bells are sounding! Hey, everyone call your families out! Move quickly!
attributes.name: Villager

attributes.content: What's happening!? It's been so long! Why is it happening today?!
attributes.name: Villager

attributes.content: Excuse me! Can I ask what's happening?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Are you—are you outsiders? The bells mean monsters are coming from the west mountains!
attributes.name: Villager

attributes.content: Those monsters can't stand light! Just run to where the sun is and you'll be safe!
attributes.name: Villager

attributes.content: M—Monsters? What monsters?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Look, I've got no time to chat with you! Get out of my way, I need to bring my wife over here!
attributes.name: Villager

attributes.content: Mama! Mama!
attributes.name: Child

attributes.content: Is everyone here? We're still missing someone! Start looking, fast!
attributes.name: Villager

attributes.content: Benefactors, benefactors, let us hurry and take shelter!
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: They said we'll be fine if we run somewhere where the sun is? Then let us hurry—benefactors?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: ...Kroos.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Ready.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Good.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: —Benefactors!? This is no time for jokes, we're no better than paste on our own! Let's hide before we do anything else!
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Here! Here, here! Why are you charging them! Alas! My good benefactors, you—wait for me, wait for me a moment!
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing
